content:
re :but then when I wanted to do that on an external hard drive, I couldn't find any "paste" option. Where is that?

Suggest you copy the 'Thunderbird' folder as it contains everything. In external drive, create a folder called eg: 'TB Backup' then select the 'TB Backup' folder which currently is empty, right click in folder and select 'Paste'.

creator: pcp04

content:
This is not a Thunderbird problem.

A couple of possible reasons. You sent an email to a valid email address but it was not the correct email address eg: a typo So someone else received the email. Check the email address you used to send TO brother, the copy in Sent folder would show it.

The email was received by BT but it got put into the server Junk/Spam folder. If your brother uses a POP mail acount then Pop can only see what is in the Inbox and download to pop mail account Inbox. So, it would not get downloaded. Brother would need to logon to the BT webmail account to check if anything is in the Junk/Spam folder. If it is in that folder then he would need to set it as Not junk and perhaps modify settings to always allow your email address. So emails go his Inbox and stay there.

If your brothers webmail account has reached a full quota then it cannot receive any emails, but usually you would get a message back from the server saying it could not be delivered. Again, if you are using a Pop mail account and that mailor daemon email got put in your gmail junk/spam folder then you would not see it unless you logged on to the gmail webmail account.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Hola No tengo consultas actuales sobre este problema y tengo varios Thunderbird funcionado sin problemas, por lo tanto supongo que no es un problema general del Thunderbird sino un problema de tu perfil (carpeta de perfil) la reinstalar no cambiar la carpeta de Perfil, prueba crear un perfil nuevo y crear la cuenta de correo nuevamente: https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/perfiles-de-thunderbird Saludos

content:
Afin que nous puissions mieux enquêter sur ce problème, nous avons besoins de davantage d’informations.

Pouvez-vous faire les actions suivantes ?

  1. Ouvrez le menu > ? (Aide) > Informations de dépannage, puis cliquez sur {button Copier le texte dans le presse-papier}
  • Allez sur https://pastebin.com, collez les informations de votre page d’informations de dépannage, utilisez le bouton Create New Paste pour créer une page contenant vos infos, puis copiez l’adresse web (URL) obtenue après création de la page.
  1. Ouvrez une réponse à ce message et collez le lien vers les informations de dépannage que vous venez de copier.

Ensuite, nous avons besoin que vous fournissiez les réponses aux questions suivantes :

  • Est-ce que Thunderbird fonctionne en mode sans échec ?
  • Utilisez-vous un antivirus et un pare-feu ? Dans quelle version ?
  • Qui est votre fournisseur de messagerie (par exemple, Gmail) ?
  • Qui est votre fournisseur d’accès à Internet (par exemple, Orange) ?
  • Quel est le message d’erreur exact ?
  • Quelles actions avez-vous faites juste avant ce qui est arrivé ?

content:
You've set up end-to-end encryption for your account and told Thunderbird to 'Store draft messages in encrypted format'. For whatever reason the key or cert you specified doesn't exist. So you'd need to fix your settings.

At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡ > Account Settings - End-To-End Encryption
creator: christ1

content:
Many thanks - looks like draft saved OK now. Not sure how that happened to get end to end encryption . . . yes I know it doesnt happen on its own . . . .

But I still dont know what a "keyring" is, or where to find it - despite doing much searching on this site. It would be helpful if popup messages and documentation were better.

And yes, I have contributed to Thunderbird.

Helpful - yes of course, thanking you, appreciated.
creator: jenkswk

content:
But I still dont know what a "keyring" is, or where to find it

It's where Thunderbird stores your OpenPGP keys. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡ > Tools > OpenPGP Key Manager

There is plenty of documentation about OpenPGP. The FAQ may be a good start. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/openpgp-thunderbird-howto-and-faq
creator: christ1

content:
Many thanks for the info as to how to get to the "OpenPGP Key Manager" and for the link.

My point is that the message said go to the "keyring", it didnt say go to the "OpenPGP Key Manager".

For the NEW to Thunderbird a lack of clarity wasnt helpful - if it had been clear I might not have had to request help - the help which I much appreciate - but the time could have been used to helped someone with a more serious problem.

Many thanks for your help and pointing me in the right direction.

content:
Okay, this may sound strange, but here is the way to set fonts on Thunderbird. Here goes: - in Tools>settings>general, set your default font. - then click the advanced button. Notice the drop-down menu at top. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - this is IMPORTANT: - select 'latin from that menu, set your desired font and font size settings, click OK, - select 'otherwritingsystems' from the drop-down menu and set the IDENTICAL settings to what you did for Latin, and then click OK.

TIP: I suggest setting font size to 20 if you are having trouble reading. Setting to 16 or lower may be too small.
creator: davidsk

content: Had the same problem after the latest update broke my familiar TB user interface - tiny fonts in the message pane for to/from/subject and the body text. Nothing seemed to change them in the settings, nor the view menu (which changed everything EXCEPT the message pane email body text) - but the above change to "other writing systems" worked like magic! (Linux Mint xfce 64, 21.3 Victoria, Thunderbird 102.13) My comment, while grateful for the peer support, is that such a complicated, non-intuitive way of making emails readable, is unacceptable! I can "get used to" unwelcome GUI changes, but having emails that I can't read without squinting close to the screen - no thanks. But thanks for the solution - that is really appreciated!!!

content:
Hey Monica,

- select the account on the left - right click & choose "settings" - a pop up appears - on the left of the pop up there is a "Return Receipts" option - Select that

You can either select "global preferences" and hit the checkbox for "always request a return receipt" or customize for the specific account and select "always request a return receipt"

If you only want it for 1 email, de-select after the email is sent.

Hope it helps you! Let me know if you need more support.

creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thunderbird is just a program running on your computer. It is an email client program. It does not require any password to run Thunderbird. Thunderbird does not offer email addresses and does not have a server. You do not 'log in' to Thunderbird.

The mail accounts you create in Thunderbird require an email address which you have already created. These email addresses may be provided by your Internet Service Provider or perhaps you have created a free one with eg: gmail or perhaps you own a domain and have a website and email addresses for that domain or maybe you have an email address supplied by a business or one you have purchased.

In Thunderbird, those mail accounts use specific server settings in order to access the relevant server that receives and stores your emails. Each mail account will use a User Name = email address and will require a password to access the server. The password is the same password you use to access the webmail account for that email address. The webmail account is accessed via a browser.

You can only set up a password or modify a password in the webmail account, then you use the same password when creating the mail account for that email address in Thunderbird.

So the question is this: Q: Have you created a mail account in Thunderbird for an email address that already exists and it's been working for a while, but is now refusing to download emails or send emails?

If yes: Post the following information.

  • Menu icon > Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • Scroll to 'Mail and News Accounts'
  • Ideally, upload an image showing all the data in that section in to this forum question
  • OR copy all the data information and paste it into this forum question.

If you get an error message post an image of the error message.

Q: Are you trying to create a new mail account for an email address? If yes: First you need to confirm you have a good password. Logon to your webmail account for that email address using a browser. If you can confirm you get access to your emails then you know the password is good and this is the password you use when creating the mail account.

Please report back and confirm you can access the webmail account, so you know the correct password for that email address.

Q: Do you get an error message when trying to create the account or download emails or send emails? If yes: post an image of the error message.


re :WHEN I TRY TO LOG IN TO THUNDERBIRD, All the information I posted above is all about mail accounts created in Thunderbird that require passwords in order to access servers. You need to provide more information about where you try to "Login to Thunderbird"
creator: Toad-Hall
